SEARCH
Package pl.put.poznan.sortingMadness.logic

Interface SortingInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
BubbleSort, HeapSort, InsertionSort, MergeSort, QuickSort, SelectionSort
public interface SortingInterface
The SortingInterface defines a contract for all sorting algorithms in the system. Implementing classes must provide a sorting algorithm implementation that works with a given comparator and supports both ascending and descending order.

  • Field Details

    • name

      static final String name
      Name of the sorting algorithm. This field can be used to identify the algorithm type.

    • setIterationLimit

    • getIterationLimit

      Returns:
      the maximum number of iterations allowed

    • sort

      <T> SortResult<T> sort(ArrayList<T> data, Comparator<? super T> comparator, boolean descOrder)
      Sorts the given list of data using the specified comparator and order. The method sorts the data either in ascending or descending order based on the value of the descOrder parameter.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      data - the list of elements to be sorted
      comparator - the comparator defining the sorting order
      descOrder - if true, sorts the data in descending order; otherwise, in ascending order
      Returns:
      a SortResult containing the sorted data and the time taken for sorting
